ru.tehkode.permissions.data

Class MatcherGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.tehkode.permissions.data.MatcherGroup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<MatcherGroup>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MemoryMatcherGroup, SQLMatcherGroup, YamlMatcherGroup

    public abstract class MatcherGroup
extends Object
implements Comparable<MatcherGroup>
    Represents a matcher group. This object is immutable. If a matcher group is changed, it becomes invalid (meaning that write operations will return null). The latest values must be fetched again from the backend in that case.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MatcherGroup.InvalidGroupException
      Thrown when a group's data is no longer valid

      • getName

        public abstract String getName()
        Return the name of this matcher group Constants for common values are the _KEY strings of MatcherGroup
        Returns:
        this group's name

      • getQualifiers

        public abstract com.google.common.collect.Multimap<Qualifier,String> getQualifiers()
        Return a list of qualifiers associated with this match group.
        Returns:
        The qualifiers associated with this group (unmodifiable)

      • setQualifiersImpl

        protected abstract com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<MatcherGroup> setQualifiersImpl(com.google.common.collect.Multimap<Qualifier,String> qualifiers)

      • setQualifiers

        public final com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<MatcherGroup> setQualifiers(com.google.common.collect.Multimap<Qualifier,String> qualifiers)
        Set the qualifiers in this group, returning an updated group object.
        A MatcherGroupEvent will be called for this method with action MatcherGroupEvent.Action.CHANGE_QUALIFIERS
        Parameters:
        qualifiers - The qualifiers to set for this group.
        Returns:
        an updated group object

      • getEntries

        public abstract Map<String,String> getEntries()
        Return the entries associated with this group. If this group's values are a list, this method will return null.
        Returns:
        the immutable result.

      • isMap

        public boolean isMap()
        Returns:
        whether or not the data contained in this group is a map.

      • getEntriesList

        public abstract List<String> getEntriesList()
        Returns the list of entries associated with this group. If this group's values are mappings, this method will return null.
        Returns:
        the immutable result.

      • isList

        public boolean isList()
        Returns:
        whether not the data contained in this group is a list.

      • setEntries

        public final com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<MatcherGroup> setEntries(Map<String,String> value)
        Sets this group's entries to a map. An immutable copy of the provided map will be made for storage. Values must not be null.
        A MatcherGroupEvent will be called for this method with action MatcherGroupEvent.Action.CHANGE_ENTRIES
        Parameters:
        value - the value to set as entries.
        Returns:
        the new matcher group object, or null if this group's already invalid

      • setEntriesImpl

        protected abstract com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<MatcherGroup> setEntriesImpl(Map<String,String> value)
        Implementation of the set entries method not handling event calling logic
        See Also:
        setEntries(java.util.List)

      • setEntries

        public final com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<MatcherGroup> setEntries(List<String> value)
        Sets this group's entries as a list. An immutable copy of the provided list will be made for storage.
        A MatcherGroupEvent will be called for this method with action MatcherGroupEvent.Action.CHANGE_ENTRIES
        Parameters:
        value - The values to set as entries.
        Returns:
        the new matcher group object, or null if this group's already invalid.

      • setEntriesImpl

        protected abstract com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<MatcherGroup> setEntriesImpl(List<String> value)

      • putEntry

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<MatcherGroup> putEntry(String key,
                                                                        String value)
        Adds an entry to the current mapping of entries.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to add
        value - The value to add
        Returns:
        null if the current value is not a map, otherwise the result of setEntries(Map).
        See Also:
        for error conditions.

      • addEntry

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<MatcherGroup> addEntry(String value)
        Adds an entry to the current list of entries
        Parameters:
        value - The value to add
        Returns:
        future with IllegalStateException if the current value is not a list, otherwise the result of setEntries(List)
        See Also:
        for error conditions

      • removeEntry

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<MatcherGroup> removeEntry(String key)
        Remove an entry from either the list or map used to store entries for this group. (yeah, it's a single method. Isn't that cool?)
        Parameters:
        key - The key or list entry to remove.
        Returns:
        The new matcher group, this if this group didn't contain the provided entry, or MatcherGroup.InvalidGroupException if this matcher group is invalid.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()

      • matches

        public boolean matches(Context context)
        Returns whether this group matches the provided context, based on this group's qualifiers. Only needs to match one of each qualifier on this group.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to verify
        Returns:
        whether or not a match is performed.

      • isValid

        public abstract boolean isValid()
        Returns if this matcher group is valid. A matcher group object becomes invalid if its entries or qualifiers have changed or it has been removed.
        Returns:
        Whether this object is valid

      • remove

        public final com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Boolean> remove()
        Removes this matcher group from the listing
        Returns:
        true if matcher was removed, false if isValid() returns false or if for some other reason the backend doesn't feel like removing this matcher.
